results.title: The Rescuers
results.creator_credit: Art Stevens, John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Courageous rescues are the specialty of secret agent mice, Bernard and Bianca. An innocent orphan named Penny is kidnapped by Madame Medusa, a wickedly wacky villainess. Madame Medusa needs Penny to recover a priceless jewel. Bernard and Bianca set out to save Penny from Madame Medusa’s evil clutches. Voices are provided by Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor and Geraldine Page. Animated.

results.title: The Prophecies of Nostradamus
results.creator_credit: Antonia Benedek and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Mysteries (Ep 3)”.
In this film, Henry Lincoln breaks through the barriers set up by innumerable interpreters which has obscured the real Nostradamus and reveals what the man himself was like and what he actually wrote.

results.title: The Prince of Egypt
results.creator_credit: Simon Wells, Steve Hickner, Brenda Chapman, Sandra Rabins, Penney Finkelman Cox and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: An animated musical film which tells the story of Moses, based on the book of Exodus in the Old Testament. Follows Moses from the moment his mother sends him out onto the River Nile in a basket of reeds, to his triumphant leading of his people out of slavery in Egypt. In “Prince of Egypt” Dreamworks Pictures attempts to make an animated film on the scale of an epic film. It combines the cute cornball of animated characters and musical numbers with lavish biblical backdrops, such as the magnificently realised parting of the red sea. The cast of voices includes a who’s who of Hollywood stars. (Awards: Winner of 1998 Academy Award for Best Original Song - “When You Believe”)

results.title: The Plains of Heaven
results.brief_description: In this inversion of the buddy-film two technicians manning a tracking station on the High Plains pursue diametrically opposed ways of coping with the isolation. The ageing Cunningham seems to be rejuvenated by and obsessed with the landscape while the younger Barker withdraws into the station and its attendant technology. Return to Barker’s Melbourne becomes a descent into a fragmented, nightmare cityscape. The denial of cause and effect explanations for behaviour invites a metaphysical interpretation of this ambiguously down-side existential drama of disorientation and alienation not dissimilar to Werner Herzog’s visionary dramas although without the German director’s quirky black humour. Cast: Richard Moir, Reg Evans, Gerard Kennedy.

results.title: The Piano
results.creator_credit: Jane Campion, Jan Chapman, Saddleback Productions and CiBy 2000
results.brief_description: Jane Campion’s fourth feature is a visually sumptuous and tactile tale of adultery set during the early European colonisation of New Zealand, with Harvey Keitel daringly cast in the role of a passionately romantic lover and Holly Hunter as a woman physically unable to articulate her feelings. Ada McGrath (Hunter) can hear and communicates in sign language through her young daughter, Fiona (Anna Paquin), but she can’t talk. Apart from her child, Ada’s most treasured possession is her piano. She marries a man she’s never met, a pioneer settler (Sam Neill) in New Zealand. The marriage starts badly when Neill refuses to transport Ada’s piano to his settlement. Later, he allows George Baines (Keitel), who has ‘gone native’ to have the piano. Baines then offers to return the piano to Ada - if she gives him piano lessons. These lessons become stages in an increasingly erotic courtship. Campion unfolds this striking story boldly with flashes of unexpected humour. The settlement is chilly, muddy and rainswept, a place where civilisation is barely making an impact. Hunter played solo piano and acted as piano coach on this production. Paquin became one of the youngest actors to receive an Academy Award for her performance. Cast also includes Kerry Walker, Genevieve Lemon.

results.title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
results.creator_credit: Milos Forman, Michael Hausman, Janet Yang, Oliver Stone and Ixtlan
results.brief_description: This is the story of the rise and rise of a self-confessed “smut-peddler”, Larry Flynt (Woody Harrelson) and his wife Althea (Courtney Love) and his building of a publishing empire, of which “Hustler” magazine is the figurehead. Along the way Flynt gets dragged to court by several exponent of the religious right, intent on defending the “decent folks”. At every turn, Larry fights back, using a tactic of high antics and retreat behind the “First Amendment”. Courted by the Pentecostal movement and Ruth Carter (Jimmy’s sister) played by Donna Hannover, he finally converts, only to give his campaign for “free speech and porn for all” the overtones of a crusade. The true life story of Larry Flynt is rich in sex, drugs, making money - and an assassination attempt. Who is Larry Flynt: a hedonistic, obnoxious pornograph or or an unlikely freedom of speech campaigner whose ardour is only tamed by drug addiction, mental illness, and Althea’s failing health? This film won two Oscar nominations to Forman and Harrelson. Winner of Golden Bear, Berlin - 1997. Includes cameos by Larry Flynt, James Carville (former Clinton ‘91 campaing director) and Donna Hannover.

results.title: The Pawnshop
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: Features Charlie Chaplin as the handyman in the pawnshop, and his girlfriend, the shopowner’s daughter. Shows Charlie as a combination janitor and clerk who gets involved in comic rivalry with another clerk, causing confusion with customers and turning hero in a robbery. Note: musical sound effects only.

results.title: The Pagemaster
results.creator_credit: Pixote Hunt, Joe Johnston, Paul Gertz, David Kirschner, Turner Pictures and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Richard is a shy boy but one day when he seeks refuge in a public library during a storm, he is suddenly transported into an incredible animated world filled with adventure and fantasy. In this world, anything is possible. The only limits are set by the imagination. Some of the greatest stories are made part of Richard’s life in the mystical world of “The Pagemaster.” Stars Macaulay Culkin as Richard Tyler, Christopher Lloyd as The Pagemaster, Ed Begley Jnr as Richard’s father and the voices of Whoopi Goldberg, Patrick Stewart, Frank Welker and Leonard Nimoy.

results.title: The Outsiders
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Gray Frederickson, Fred Roos, Pony Boy, Warner Bros Pictures and Zoetrope Studios
results.brief_description: The first of two films made by Coppola in 1983 and based on novels by youth fiction writer S.E. Hinton (‘The Outsiders’ was her first novel, published when she was just seventeen). Like ‘Rumble Fish’, ‘The Outsiders’ was a rites-of-passage novel that focused on the lives of disenfranchised urban male youth. Set in 1966 in Tulsa, Oklahoma, it follows the lives of the members of two rival teenage street gangs; the middle-class Greasers and the working-class Socs. When Ponyboy, the youngest of three orphaned boys who hang out with the Greasers, and his friend Johnny, are involved in a deadly confrontation with the Socs one night, the two are forced to hide out and reconsider the direction their lives are taking. Cast includes Matt Dillon, Ralph Macchio, Patrick Swayze, Rob Lowe, Emilio Estevez, Tom Cruise and Tom Waits. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: The Navigator: A Medieval Odyssey
results.creator_credit: Vincent Ward, Gary Hannam, John Maynard, New Zealand Film Commission and Arenafilm
results.brief_description: The navigator is remarkable because of its absorbing story that links medieval fears and fortunes to our times, while confirming director Vincent Ward as an original talent. It is Cumbria 1348, the year of the Black Death. A young visionary tells his fellow miners that their community may survive the plague if they place a spire on a distant cathedral before dawn. So, from their grim, snowbound Lake District, they dig down an old mine-shaft to the other side of the world, emerging in an Eastman-coloured present day Auckland, New Zealand. Cast includes Bruce Lyons, Chris Haywood and Hamish McFarlane.
